sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均有"约会"之意。
means: engagement ： 普通用词，可与本组的另外两个词换用。泛指任何商定的地点和时间见面，专指针对某一目的约会。
appointment ： 通常指严格根据时间表上预约的时间进行的约见或约会，其目的主要是讨论公事或业务问题。
date ： 主要指朋友之间的随便约见或男女之间的约会。

sentence.Network_en: I hate to rush you but I have another appointment later on.
sentence.Network_cn: 我真不想催你，但我稍后还有一个约会。

sentence.Network_en: Drake and his cohorts were not pleased with my appointment.
sentence.Network_cn: 德雷克那一帮人对我的任命很不满。

sentence.Network_en: At the time, his appointment seemed a stroke of genius.
sentence.Network_cn: 当时，对他的任命犹如神来之笔。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 高一英语单词表 - 豆丁网 ... remind vt 提醒；使想起 appointment n 约会；指定 behavior n 行为；举止；习性.

人教版九年级英语单词表_百度文库 ... optometrist 验光师 appointment 约会；约定 crucial 关键的；决定性的.

list.abs: the other day的翻译中文意思-在线英汉词典 ... apparent solar day 视太阳日 appointed day 指定日期 Arbor Day [美]植树节.
英语新词汇与常用词汇的翻译(B) -亿城英语 ... by any possibility 可能 by appointment 按照约定 by bicycle 骑脚踏车.
失望就变成了上天的指示(His appointment)。所以说任何发生在你身上的事都是好的。
[精彩] 管理学必备英语词汇 - ChinaUnix.net ... fax machine 传真机 appointment book 记事簿 stapler 订书机.

jx.jx_en_mean: having previously made an arrangement to do something

lj.lj_ls: 未经预约，谢绝参观（或来访）。

jx.jx_en_mean: (in the UK) used by manufacturers to indicate that their products are sold to the queen and are therefore of guaranteed quality
jx.jx_cn_mean: （英国） 女王陛下御用（制造商的产品宣传用语，宣称女王系其客户，以示其产品质量有保证）

jx.jx_en_mean: power to select the holder of a particular job or position
jx.jx_cn_mean: （决定由何人担任某一任务或职务的）甄选权

jx.jx_en_mean: (Law)power to decide the disposal of property, in exercise of a right conferred by the owner
jx.jx_cn_mean: (律)（由财产所有人授予的）财产处置权

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English : from Old French apointement, from apointer (see appoint)

entry.def: The appointment of a person to a particular job is the choice of that person to do it.

example.ex: His appointment to the Cabinet would please the right-wing.
example.tran: 他被任命为内阁成员会让右翼党派很高兴。
在1985年他被委任为外交部长

entry.def: An appointment is a job or position of responsibility.

example.ex: Mr Fay is to take up an appointment as a researcher with the Royal Society.
example.tran: 费伊先生将担任皇家学会研究员的职务。

entry.def: If you have an appointment with someone, you have arranged to see them at a particular time, usually in connection with their work or for a serious purpose.

example.ex: She has an appointment with her accountant...
example.tran: 她和她的会计约好了见面。

example.ex: I made an appointment to see a specialist.

entry.def: If something can be done by appointment, people can arrange in advance to do it at a particular time.

means.word_mean: 1. the act of putting a person into a non-elective position;

sentences.sentence: "the appointment had to be approved by the whole committee"
"she asked how to avoid kissing at the end of a date"

means.word_mean: 3. (usually plural) furnishings and equipment (especially for a ship or hotel)
4. a person who is appointed to a job or position
5. the job to which you are (or hope to be) appointed;

sentences.sentence: "he applied for an appointment in the treasury"

means.word_mean: 6. (law) the act of disposing of property by virtue of the power of appointment;

sentences.sentence: "she allocated part of the trust to her church by appointment"

auth_sentence.content: I made an appointment to meet my new teacher.
auth_sentence.res_content: I made an appointment to meet my new teacher.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I made an appointment to meet my new teacher.

auth_sentence.content: Why is his appointment to the military commission significant?
auth_sentence.res_content: Why is his appointment to the military commission significant?

auth_sentence.res_content: Mr Deighton has also spoken of his new appointment.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mr Deighton has also spoken of his new appointment.

stems_affixes.word_buile: appoint[v.指定,任命]+ment表名词→n.约会, 指定
point点,变尖,指,针→n.点, 尖端, 分数 v.弄尖,指向,指出 v.指
point点,变尖,指,针+er表名词→尖的东西→指针

stems_affixes.value_cn: 使失望; 使受挫折;对……失信
stems_affixes.word_buile: dis不+appoint任命→不被任命→使失望
point点,变尖,指,针→n.点, 尖端, 分数 v.弄尖,指向,指出 v.指

Sentence.sentence: Arranging the woman's appointment with Mr. Romero.
Make an appointment for an interview
She was late for the appointment.

means.word_mean: 约会, 约定, 预约

sentences.en: I have an appointment with him at four o'clock.
sentences.cn: 我和他四点钟有个约会。

sentences.en: They made an appointment for the second day of May.
sentences.cn: 他们在五月二号有个约会。

sentences.en: He secured the appointment of professor of English literature in the university.
sentences.cn: 他获聘为该大学的英国文学教授。

sentences.en: They made the appointment of Peter as chairman of the union.
sentences.cn: 他们任命彼得为工会主席。

jushi.english: The director won't see you unless you have an appointment.
jushi.chinese: 除非你事先约好,否则董事长不会见你。

jushi.english: He secured the appointment of professor of English literature in the university.
jushi.chinese: 他被任命为大学的英国文学教授。

jushi.english: They made an appointment for the second day of May.
jushi.chinese: 他们在五月二号有个约会。
